title: Fighting An Insect Invasion With... An Insect Invasion
description: The spotted lanternfly is eating its way through trees and crops in eastern Pennsylvania. NPR science correspondent Dan Charles explains how scientists hope to stop the spread of this invasive pest by importing a natural enemy from its home in China. Follow host Maddie Sofia on Twitter @maddie_sofia. Email the show at shortwave@npr.org.

itunes:title: Fighting An Insect Invasion With... An Insect Invasion
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: An invasive species has no significant natural predators here. Yet.
itunes:subtitle: An invasive species has no significant natural predators here. Yet.
